name: Check the status of a workflow\n href: check-status-workflow.md\n - name: Download workflow history reports\n- href: download-workflow-history.md \n+ href: download-workflow-history.md\n+ - name: Manage inactive users (Preview)\n+ href: lifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md \n - name: Check execution user scope\n href: check-workflow-execution-scope.md \n - name: Customize the schedule of workflows" }, { "sha": "bc2c36f39d070ee8260430aa5b79c018e850f2f6", "filename": "docs/id-governance/customize-workflow-email.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 18, "deletions": 5, "changes": 23, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fcustomize-workflow-email.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fcustomize-workflow-email.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fcustomize-workflow-email.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -7,7 +7,7 @@ manager: dougeby\n ms.service: entra-id-governance\n ms.subservice: lifecycle-workflows\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 05/25/2025\n+ms.date: 09/22/2025\n ms.custom: template-how-to\n ---\n \n@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@ Email tasks allow for the customization of:\n - Message body\n - Email language\n \n-When you're customizing the subject or message body, we recommend that you also enable the custom sender domain and organizational branding. Otherwise, your email will contain an additional security disclaimer.\n+When you're customizing the subject or message body, we recommend that you also enable the custom sender domain and organizational branding. Otherwise, your email contains an additional security disclaimer.\n \n For more information on these customizable parameters, see [Common email task parameters](lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#common-email-task-parameters).\n \n@@ -57,13 +57,26 @@ When you're customizing an email sent via lifecycle workflows, you can choose to\n \n 1. Enter a custom subject, a message body, and the email language translation option that will be used to translate the message body of the email. \n \n- If you stay with the default templates and don't customize the subject and body of the email, the text will be automatically translated into the recipient's preferred language. If you select an email language, the determination based on the recipient's preferred language will be overridden. If you specify a custom subject or body, it won't be translated.\n+ If you stay with the default templates and don't customize the subject and body of the email, the text is automatically translated into the recipient's preferred language. If you select an email language, the determination based on the recipient's preferred language is overridden. If you specify a custom subject or body, it won't be translated.\n \n :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/customize-workflow-email/customize-workflow-email-example.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of an example of a customized email from a workflow.\":::\n \n 1. Select **Save** to capture your changes in the customized email.\n \n-## Format attributes within customized emails\n+## Customize email text\n+\n+Emails sent by workflows can have their text customized to personalize, or stress specific points within, them. Workflow text can currently be customized in the following ways:\n+\n+- **Bold**: Text within emails can be bolded by placing the desired text within `` brackets.\n+- **Italics**: Text within emails can be italicized by placing the desired text within `` brackets.\n+- **Underlined**: Text within emails can be italicized by placing the desired text within `` brackets.\n+- **Links**: Hyperlinks can be added to text by placing the desired link within ` ` brackets.\n+\n+ > [!NOTE]\n+ > Hyperlinks must start with either *http* or *https*.\n+\n+\n+### Format attributes within customized emails\n \n To further personalize customized emails, you can take advantage of dynamic attributes. By placing dynamic attributes in specific attributes, you can specifically call out values such as a user's name, their generated Temporary Access Pass, or even their manager's email.\n \n@@ -75,7 +88,7 @@ The following screenshot is an example of the proper format for dynamic attribut\n \n :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/customize-workflow-email/workflow-dynamic-attribute-example.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of an example of dynamic attributes within a customized email.\":::\n \n-When you're typing a dynamic attribute, the email is written the following way:\n+When you're typing a dynamic attribute, the email is written in the following way:\n \n ```html\n Welcome to the team, {{userGivenName}}" }, { "sha": "bd2c0b82ee30142b0ffec0636022bbe4ad393cca", "filename": "docs/id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-execution-conditions.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 24, "deletions": 1, "changes": 25, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-execution-conditions.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-execution-conditions.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-execution-conditions.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -30,6 +30,7 @@ The trigger you choose depends on what type of workflow you want to run for user\n - **Time based attribute**: The workflow is triggered on schedule when a time value is met.\n - **Attribute changes**: The workflow is triggered on schedule when a change to an attribute happens.\n - **Group membership change**: The workflow is triggered on schedule when a group membership change is met.\n+- **Sign-in activity**: The workflow is triggered on schedule when a minimum number of days since the user last signed in is met.\n - **On-demand only**: The workflow is only triggered manually.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n@@ -116,11 +117,33 @@ The group membership change scope allows you to define for who the workflow runs\n \n When setting the scope of the group membership change trigger, the following details are defined:\n \n-|Scope detail |Description |\n+|Trigger detail |Description |\n |---------|---------|\n |Scope type | Group based. |\n |Selected group | Defines the group for which the trigger action is based on. |\n \n+## Sign-in inactivity trigger\n+\n+The **Sign-in inactivity** trigger allows you to set a trigger based on when a certain number of days has passed since the user last signed in.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-execution-conditions/sign-in-inactivity-trigger.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the sign-in inactivity trigger.\":::\n+\n+When setting the scope of the sign-in inactivity trigger, the following details are defined:\n+\n+\n+|Scope detail |Description |\n+|---------|---------|\n+|Days of inactivity | The number of days since the user last signed in. |\n+\n+### Sign-in inactivity scope\n+\n+The sign-in inactivity scope allows you to define for who the workflow runs when the sign-in inactivity trigger is met.\n+\n+|Scope detail |Description |\n+|---------|---------|\n+|Scope type | Rule based. |\n+|Rule | Defines the rule for who meets the scope of the attribute changes trigger. |\n+\n ## On-demand only trigger\n \n The **On-demand only** trigger is set to run the workflow for users you manually select. Workflows with these triggers don't run on a schedule. The users are selected within the scope details section of the workflow." }, { "sha": "a0ef5e7b8d12cbc17c522faa80f1321690e9c639", "filename": "docs/id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md", "status": "added", "additions": 50, "deletions": 0, "changes": 50, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@\n+---\n+title: Manage inactive users using Lifecycle Workflows (Preview)\n+description: This article walks you through managing inactive users with Lifecycle Workflows.\n+author: owinfreyATL\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.service: entra-id-governance\n+ms.subservice: lifecycle-workflows\n+ms.topic: how-to #Required; leave this attribute/value as-is\n+ms.date: 08/28/2025\n+\n+#CustomerIntent: As an IT administrator, I want to automate managing users with Lifecycle Workflows so that management and security is streamlined.\n+---\n+\n+# Manage inactive users using Lifecycle Workflows (Preview)\n+\n+As part of supporting users no matter where they fall in the Joiner-Mover-Leaver (JML) model of their lifecycle within your organization, Lifecycle Workflows support automating the disabling and deleting of users once they are inactive for a set period of time. This [sign-in inactivity](lifecycle-workflow-execution-conditions.md#sign-in-inactivity-trigger) allows you to set a workflow to run when a user is inactive for a set number of days. This feature allows you to seamlessly maintain a secure environment by automating the removal of inactive based on criteria you set for your organization.\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [Microsoft Entra ID Governance license](~/includes/entra-entra-governance-license.md)]\n+\n+\n+## Manage inactive users using the Microsoft Entra Admin Center\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **workflows**.\n+\n+1. On the workflow screen, select the specific workflow you want to add the inactive user task to, or create a new workflow based on a template.\n+ > [!NOTE]\n+ > To use any of the leaver tasks, you must select a leaver workflow template.\n+1. On the **Basics** tab, after entering a unique display name and description for the workflow, select the **Sign-in inactivity** trigger.\n+\n+1. Once you select your desired workflow template enter in basic details, and then select the **Sign-in inactivity** trigger.\n+\n+1. Under the **Days of inactivity**, enter the number of days you want the trigger to run for if exceeded, and then select **Next**.\n+ :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-inactive-users/inactivity-trigger.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of days of inactivity.\":::\n+1. On the **Scope** page, enter the scope you want for the trigger, and then select **Next**.\n+\n+1. On the **Review Tasks** page, select the task you want to run for the users who you consider to be inactive and select **Review + Create**.\n+ > [!NOTE]\n+ > Lifecycle Workflows comes with a built-in task, [Send email about user inactivity (Preview)](lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#send-email-about-user-inactivity-preview), that is directly related to helping manage inactive users.\n+\n+\n+## Next step\n+\n+- [Manage workflow versions](manage-workflow-tasks.md)\n+- [Manage workflow properties](manage-workflow-properties.md)\n+" }, { "sha": "d3ed6899df0836e30fd7e47310ce10667ac3cc33", "filename": "docs/id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 69, "deletions": 17, "changes": 86, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-tasks.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-tasks.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-tasks.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ Common task parameters are the non-unique parameters contained in every task. Wh\n |---------|---------|\n |category | A read-only string that identifies the category or categories of the task. Automatically determined when the taskDefinitionID is chosen. |\n |taskDefinitionId | A string referencing a taskDefinition that determines which task to run. |\n-|isEnabled | A boolean value that denotes whether the task is set to run or not. If set to “true\" then the task runs. Defaults to true. |\n+|isEnabled | A boolean value that denotes whether the task is set to run or not. If set to “*true\"* then the task runs. Defaults to true. |\n |displayName | A unique string that identifies the task. |\n |description | A string that describes the purpose of the task for administrative use. (Optional) |\n |executionSequence | A read-only integer that states in what order the task runs in a workflow. |\n@@ -56,10 +56,10 @@ Recipients of the emails can be:\n > [!NOTE]\n > Additional CC recipients are only available if the recipient is the user themselves or their manager. If there are multiple CC recipients, they're copied on the single individual email. \n \n-Under **Email Customization** you're able to customize the specific email message send out by the task. If you choose to customize the email, you're able to set the following arguments:\n+Under **Email Customization** you're able to customize the specific email message sent out by the task. If you choose to customize the email, you're able to set the following arguments:\n \n - **Subject**: Customizes the subject of emails.\n-- **Message body**: Customizes the body of the emails being sent out.\n+- **Message body**: Customizes the body of the emails being sent out and can be further customized using [HTML elements](customize-workflow-email.md#customize-email-text).\n - **Email language translation**: Overrides the email recipient's language settings. Custom text isn't customized, and it's recommended to set this language to the same language as the custom text. \n \n :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-task/customize-email-concept.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the customization email options.\":::\n@@ -205,7 +205,7 @@ Example of usage within the workflow:\n Microsoft Entra allows you to use a [Temporary Access Pass (TAP)](..//identity/authentication/howto-authentication-temporary-access-pass.md) to set up password-less credentials for users. You can also use [Microsoft Entra self-service password reset](../identity/authentication/concept-sspr-howitworks.md) to set a regular password. With this task, Lifecycle workflows allow you to automatically generate a Temporary Access Pass (TAP), and have it sent to the new user's manager. You're also able to customize the email that is sent to the user's manager.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> The user's employee hire date is used as the start time for the Temporary Access Pass. Please make sure that the TAP lifetime task setting and the [time portion of your user's hire date](how-to-lifecycle-workflow-sync-attributes.md#importance-of-time) are set appropriately so that the TAP is still valid when the user starts their first day. If the hire date at the time of workflow execution is already in the past, the current time is used as the start time.\n+> The user's employee hire date is used as the start time for the Temporary Access Pass. Make sure that the TAP lifetime task setting and the [time portion of your user's hire date](how-to-lifecycle-workflow-sync-attributes.md#importance-of-time) are set appropriately so that the TAP is still valid when the user starts their first day. If the hire date at the time of workflow execution is already in the past, the current time is used as the start time.\n \n With this task in the Microsoft Entra admin center, you're able to give the task a name and description. You must also set:\n \n@@ -230,7 +230,7 @@ For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Generate Temporary Access Pass and\n |displayName | GenerateTAPAndSendEmail (Customizable by user) |\n |description | Generate Temporary Access Pass and send via email to user's manager (Customizable by user) |\n |taskDefinitionId | 1b555e50-7f65-41d5-b514-5894a026d10d |\n-|arguments | Argument contains the name parameter \"tapLifetimeInMinutes\", which is the lifetime of the temporaryAccessPass in minutes starting at startDateTime. Minimum 10, Maximum 43200 (equivalent to 30 days). The argument also contains the tapIsUsableOnce parameter, which determines whether the passcode is limited to a one time use. If true, the pass can be used once; if false, the pass can be used multiple times within the temporaryAccessPass lifetime. Additionally, the optional common email task parameters can be specified; if they aren't included, the default behavior takes effect. |\n+|arguments | Argument contains the name parameter \"tapLifetimeInMinutes,\" which is the lifetime of the temporaryAccessPass in minutes starting at startDateTime. Minimum 10, Maximum 43200 (equivalent to 30 days). The argument also contains the tapIsUsableOnce parameter, which determines whether the passcode is limited to a one time use. If true, the pass can be used once; if false, the pass can be used multiple times within the temporaryAccessPass lifetime. Additionally, the optional common email task parameters can be specified; if they aren't included, the default behavior takes effect. |\n \n Example of usage within the workflow:\n \n@@ -290,7 +290,7 @@ For Microsoft Graph the parameters for the **Send email to notify manager of use\n |displayName | Send email to notify manager of user move (Customizable by user) |\n |description | Send email to notify user’s manager of user move (Customizable by user) |\n |taskDefinitionId | aab41899-9972-422a-9d97-f626014578b7 |\n-|arguments | The optional common email task parameters can be specified; if they are not included, the default behavior takes effect. |\n+|arguments | The optional common email task parameters can be specified; if they aren't included, the default behavior takes effect. |\n \n Example of usage within the workflow:\n \n@@ -327,7 +327,7 @@ Example of usage within the workflow:\n \n Allows you to request an access package assignment for users. If an approval process is configured for the access package and should take place, you must opt-into the `Enforce policy approval setting for admin direct assignments` Entitlement Management setting. For more information on access packages, see [What are access packages and what resources can I manage with them?](entitlement-management-overview.md#what-are-access-packages-and-what-resources-can-i-manage-with-them).\n \n-You're able to customize the task name and task description for this task. You must also select the access package and policy that is being requested for the user.\n+You're able to customize the task name and task description for this task. You must also select the access package and policy that's being requested for the user.\n :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-task/request-user-access-package-assignment-task.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the request user access package assignment task.\":::\n \n For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Request user access package assignment** task are as follows:\n@@ -338,7 +338,7 @@ For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Request user access package assign\n |displayName | Request user access package assignment (Customizable by user) |\n |description | Request user assignment to selected access package (Customizable by user) |\n |taskDefinitionId | c1ec1e76-f374-4375-aaa6-0bb6bd4c60be |\n-|arguments | Argument contains two name parameter that is the \"assignmentPolicyId\", and \"accessPackageId\". |\n+|arguments | Argument contains two name parameter that is the \"assignmentPolicyId,\" and \"accessPackageId\". |\n \n Example of usage within the workflow:\n \n@@ -376,7 +376,7 @@ Allows Licenses to be assigned to users. For a license to be assigned to the use\n |displayName | Assign licenses to user (Customizable by user) |\n |description | Assign selected licenses to the user (Customizable by user) |\n |taskDefinitionId | 683c87a4-2ad4-420b-97d4-220d90afcd24 |\n-|arguments | Argument contains one parameter that has the name \"*licenses*\" that accepts a \"*Sku ID*\" value. For a full list of these values, see: [Product names and service plan identifiers for licensing](../identity/users/licensing-service-plan-reference.md). |\n+|arguments | Argument contains one parameter that has the name \"*licenses*\" that accepts a \"*SKU ID*\" value. For a full list of these values, see: [Product names and service plan identifiers for licensing](../identity/users/licensing-service-plan-reference.md). |\n \n Example of usage within the workflow:\n \n@@ -452,7 +452,7 @@ For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Add user to teams** task are as fo\n |displayName | AddUserToTeam (Customizable by user) |\n |description | Add user to teams (Customizable by user) |\n |taskDefinitionId | e440ed8d-25a1-4618-84ce-091ed5be5594 |\n-|argument | Argument contains a name parameter that is the \"teamID\", and a value parameter that is the team ID of the existing team you're adding a user to. |\n+|argument | Argument contains a name parameter that is the \"teamID,\" and a value parameter that is the team ID of the existing team you're adding a user to. |\n \n \n \n@@ -519,7 +519,7 @@ Workflows can be configured to launch a custom task extension. You're able to cu\n \n The Microsoft Entra prerequisite to run the **Run a Custom Task Extension** task is:\n \n-- A Logic App that is compatible with the custom task extension. For more information, see: [Lifecycle workflow extensibility](lifecycle-workflow-extensibility.md).\n+- A Logic App that's compatible with the custom task extension. For more information, see: [Lifecycle workflow extensibility](lifecycle-workflow-extensibility.md).\n \n For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Run a Custom Task Extension** task are as follows:\n \n@@ -529,7 +529,7 @@ For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Run a Custom Task Extension** task\n |displayName | Run a Custom Task Extension (Customizable by user) |\n |description | Run a Custom Task Extension to call-out to an external system. (Customizable by user) |\n |taskDefinitionId | d79d1fcc-16be-490c-a865-f4533b1639ee |\n-|argument | Argument contains a name parameter that is the \"customTaskExtensionID\", and a value parameter that is the ID of the previously created extension that contains information about the Logic App. |\n+|argument | Argument contains a name parameter that is the \"customTaskExtensionID,\" and a value parameter that is the ID of the previously created extension that contains information about the Logic App. |\n \n \n \n@@ -608,7 +608,7 @@ For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Remove user from selected groups**\n |displayName | Remove user from selected groups (Customizable by user) |\n |description | Remove user from membership of selected Microsoft Entra groups (Customizable by user) |\n |taskDefinitionId | 1953a66c-751c-45e5-8bfe-01462c70da3c |\n-|argument | Argument contains a name parameter that is the \"groupID\", and a value parameter that is the group Id(s) of the group or groups you're removing the user from. |\n+|argument | Argument contains a name parameter that is the \"groupID,\" and a value parameter that is the group Id(s) of the group or groups you're removing the user from. |\n \n \n \n@@ -747,7 +747,7 @@ For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Remove access package assignment f\n \n ```Example for usage within the workflow\n {\n- \"category\": \"leaver,mover\",\n+ \"category\": \"leaver, mover\",\n \"continueOnError\": false,\n \"description\": \"Remove user assignment of selected access package\",\n \"displayName\": \"Remove access package assignment for user\",\n@@ -853,13 +853,13 @@ For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Remove selected license assignment\n |displayName | Remove licenses from user (Customizable by user) |\n |description | Remove selected licenses assigned to the user (Customizable by user) |\n |taskDefinitionId | 5fc402a8-daaf-4b7b-9203-da868b05fc5f |\n-|arguments | Argument contains one parameter that has the name \"*licenses*\" that accepts a \"Sku ID\" value. For a full list of these values, see: [Product names and service plan identifiers for licensing](../identity/users/licensing-service-plan-reference.md). |\n+|arguments | Argument contains one parameter that has the name \"*licenses*\" that accepts a \"*SKU ID*\" value. For a full list of these values, see: [Product names and service plan identifiers for licensing](../identity/users/licensing-service-plan-reference.md). |\n \n Example of usage within the workflow:\n \n ```Example for usage within the workflow \n {\n- \"category\": \"leaver,mover\",\n+ \"category\": \"leaver, mover\",\n \"description\": \"Remove selected licenses assigned to the user\",\n \"displayName\": \"Remove licenses from user\",\n \"id\": \"5fc402a8-daaf-4b7b-9203-da868b05fc5f\",\n@@ -886,7 +886,7 @@ For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Revoke all refresh tokens for user\n \n |Parameter |Definition |\n |---------|---------|\n-|category | leaver,mover |\n+|category | leaver, mover |\n |displayName | Revoke all refresh tokens for user |\n |description | Revoke all refresh tokens for user |\n |taskDefinitionId | 509589a4-0466-4471-829e-49c5e502bdee |\n@@ -1127,6 +1127,58 @@ Example of usage within the workflow:\n }\n ```\n \n+### Send email about user inactivity (Preview)\n+\n+Allows an email containing information about an inactive user to be sent to the user's manager after a specified number of days as their last sign-in. You're able to customize the task name and description for this task in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-task/send-email-user-inactivity-task.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of Workflows task: send inactivity email.\":::\n+\n+The Microsoft Entra prerequisites to run the **Send email about user inactivity (Preview)** task are:\n+\n+- A populated manager attribute for the user.\n+- A populated manager's mail attribute for the user.\n+\n+\n+For Microsoft Graph, the parameters for the **Send email about user inactivity (Preview)** task are as follows:\n+\n+|Parameter |Definition |\n+|---------|---------|\n+|category | leaver |\n+|displayName | Send email about user inactivity (Preview) |\n+|description | Notify manager that user has been inactive (Customizable by user) |\n+|taskDefinitionId | 92f74cb4-f1b6-4ec0-b766-96210f56edc2 |\n+|arguments | The optional common email task parameters can be specified; if they aren't included, the default behavior takes effect. |\n+\n+Example of usage within the workflow:\n+\n+```json\n+{\n+ \"category\": \"leaver\",\n+ \"continueOnError\": false,\n+ \"description\": \" Notify manager that user has been inactive\",\n+ \"displayName\": \"Send email about user inactivity (Preview)\",\n+ \"isEnabled\": true,\n+ \"taskDefinitionId\": \"92f74cb4-f1b6-4ec0-b766-96210f56edc2\",\n+ \"arguments\": [\n+ {\n+ \"name\": \"cc\",\n+ \"value\": \"1bda0458-cb4b-473d-baf5-61125c86a6d3,7f552c25-e0f6-40b6-b4e0-36bb40ba7fb6\"\n+ },\n+ {\n+ \"name\": \"customSubject\",\n+ \"value\": \"[UserDisplayName]’s account has been inactive for [NumberofDays] days.\"\n+ },\n+ {\n+ \"name\": \"customBody\",\n+ \"value\": \"We’re notifying you that a recent sign-in for [UserDisplayName]’s user account has not been detected, and the account is considered inactive. The last sign in was [LastSigninDate]. To maintain a secure environment, your organization may have already started the process to disable or delete this user account.\\n\\nPlease check your organization’s policies and take appropriate action if this user account is still needed.\\n\\nRegards\\nYour IT department\"\n+ },\n+ {\n+ \"name\": \"locale\",\n+ \"value\": \"en-us\"\n+ }\n+ ]\n+}\n+```\n+\n ## Next steps\n \n - [Manage lifecycle workflows properties](manage-workflow-properties.md)" }, { "sha": "08539fb1a9a2289e21f03c68a2aca449d643690d", "filename": "docs/id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-templates.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 43, "deletions": 1, "changes": 44, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-templates.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-templates.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-templates.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@ Lifecycle Workflows allows you to automate the lifecycle management process for\n \n ## Lifecycle Workflows built-in templates\n \n-Lifecycle Workflows currently have eight built-in templates you can use or customize:\n+Lifecycle Workflows currently have 12 built-in templates you can use or customize:\n \n :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-templates/templates-list.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of a list of lifecycle workflow templates.\" lightbox=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-templates/templates-list.png\":::\n \n@@ -33,6 +33,8 @@ The list of templates are as follows:\n - [Post-Offboarding of an employee](lifecycle-workflow-templates.md#post-offboarding-of-an-employee)\n - [Employee group membership changes](lifecycle-workflow-templates.md#employee-group-membership-changes)\n - [Employee job profile change](lifecycle-workflow-templates.md#employee-job-profile-change)\n+- [Pre-Offboard inactive users](lifecycle-workflow-templates.md#pre-offboard-inactive-users)\n+- [Offboard inactive users](lifecycle-workflow-templates.md#offboard-inactive-users)\n \n For a complete guide on creating a new workflow from a template, see: [Tutorial: On-boarding users to your organization using Lifecycle workflows with the Microsoft Entra admin center](tutorial-onboard-custom-workflow-portal.md).\n \n@@ -223,6 +225,46 @@ The default specific parameters for the **Employee job profile change** template\n \n For a tutorial on setting up a workflow that uses the **Employer job profile change** template, see: [Automate employee mover tasks when they change jobs using the Microsoft Entra admin center](tutorial-mover-custom-workflow-portal.md).\n \n+### Pre-Offboard inactive users\n+\n+The **Pre-Offboard inactive users** template is designed to configure tasks that must be completed before offboarding inactive users.\n+\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-templates/begin-off-board-inactive-users-template.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the pre-offboard inactive users template.\":::\n+\n+The default specific parameters for the **Pre-Offboard inactive users** template are as follows:\n+\n+|Parameter |Description |Customizable |\n+|---------|---------|---------|\n+|Category | Leaver | ❌ |\n+|Trigger Type | Sign-in inactivity, Attribute changes, Group Membership change | ✔️ |\n+|Trigger details | Depends on trigger type selection.
• **Sign-in inactivity**: Days of inactivity
• **Attribute changes**: Trigger attribute
• **Group membership changes**: Added to group/Remove from group | ✔️ |\n+|Days of inactivity | 90 | ✔️ |\n+|Event timing | Before | ❌ |\n+|Event User attribute | LastSignInDateTime | ❌ |\n+|Scope | Depends on trigger.
**Rule based**: Time based attribute, Attribute changes.
**Group membership change**: Group based. | ✔️ |\n+|Tasks | **Disable user account**, **Send inactivity notification email** | ✔️ |\n+\n+### Offboard inactive users\n+\n+The **Offboard inactive users** template is designed to configure tasks that must be completed to offboard inactive users.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-templates/off-board-inactive-users-template.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the offboard inactive users template.\":::\n+\n+The default specific parameters for the **Offboard inactive users** template are as follows:\n+\n+|Parameter |Description |Customizable |\n+|---------|---------|---------|\n+|Category | Leaver | ❌ |\n+|Trigger Type | Sign-in inactivity, Attribute changes, Group Membership change | ✔️ |\n+|Trigger details | Depends on trigger type selection.
• **Sign-in inactivity**: Days of inactivity
• **Attribute changes**: Trigger attribute
• **Group membership changes**: Added to group/Remove from group | ✔️ |\n+|Days from event | 120 | ✔️ |\n+|Event timing | After | ❌ |\n+|Event User attribute | LastSignInDateTime | ❌ |\n+|Scope | Depends on trigger.
**Rule based**: Time based attribute, Attribute changes
**Group membership change**: Group based. | ✔️ |\n+|Tasks | **Disable user account**, **Send inactivity notification email** | ✔️ |\n+\n+\n ## Next steps\n \n - [`workflowTemplate` resource "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Fapple-sso-plugin.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Fapple-sso-plugin.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Fapple-sso-plugin.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -430,7 +430,7 @@ The end user sees the familiar experience and doesn't have to sign in again in e\n \n ## Device Identity Key Storage\n \n-In March 2024, Microsoft announced that Microsoft Entra ID will transition from Apple's Keychain to Apple's Secure Enclave for storing device identity keys. Starting August 2025, the Secure Storage rollout will make Secure Enclave the default key storage for all new device registrations. New device registrations will use secure storage model by default. Existing devices that do not support Secure Enclave will have registration keys stored in the user's iCloud Keychain instead of the Login Keychain, which provides stronger protection than legacy Login Keychain storage. Existing functionality for older devices remains the same.\n+In March 2024, Microsoft announced that Microsoft Entra ID will transition from Apple's Keychain to Apple's Secure Enclave for storing device identity keys. Beginning August 2025, the Secure Storage rollout will make Secure Enclave the default key storage for all new device registrations. New device registrations will use the secure storage model by default. Existing devices that do not support Secure Enclave will have registration keys stored in the user's Keychain (but not in the legacy Login Keychain). Existing functionality for devices without Secure Storage remains the same.\n \n If your applications or MDM solutions depend on accessing Microsoft Entra device registration keys through Keychain, you must update them to use the Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL) and the Enterprise SSO plug-in to maintain compatibility with the Microsoft identity platform.\n \n@@ -498,7 +498,12 @@ If for any reason Secure Enclave needs to be disabled, follow these recommended\n \n #### Opting out of Secure Storage\n \n-To opt your tenant out of the secure storage rollout, contact Microsoft customer support to request exclusion from the secure storage deployment. Once processed, your tenant is permanently excluded from this rollout. Any devices in your tenant previously registered with secure storage must follow the previous guidance for removing and re-adding the device after the permanent opt-out is completed. To opt in for Secure storage at a future date, you must contact [Microsoft customer support](/services-hub/unified/support/open-support-requests).\n+To opt your tenant out of the secure storage rollout, contact Microsoft customer support to request exclusion from the secure storage deployment. Once processed, your tenant is temporarily excluded from this rollout for up to 6 months. Any devices in your tenant previously registered with secure storage must follow the previous guidance for removing and re-adding the device after the temporary opt-out is completed.\n+\n+> [!IMPORTANT]\n+> Temporary exclusions from secure storage are limited to 6 months and are discouraged, because they may prevent your organization from benefiting from this security enhancement and future security enhancements, and could limit support options when Microsoft eventually phases out legacy storage methods.\n+\n+To opt in for Secure storage at a future date, you must contact [Microsoft customer support](/services-hub/unified/support/open-support-requests).\n \n ### Scenarios impacted\n " }, { "sha": "fc5eac00ae07ab8d7600beaa5e38de05ede7746d", "filename": "docs/identity-platform/howto-update-permissions.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 2, "deletions": 2, "changes": 4, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Fhowto-update-permissions.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Fhowto-update-permissions.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Fhowto-update-permissions.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -90,7 +90,7 @@ To complete the following steps of adding permissions, you need the following re\n \n 1. Identify the permissions your app requires, their permission IDs, and whether they're app roles (application permissions) or delegated permissions. For example, if you want to request Microsoft Graph permissions, see [Microsoft Graph permissions](/graph/permissions-reference#permission-scenarios) for a list of permissions and their IDs.\n 1. Add the required Microsoft Graph permissions to your app.\n- The following example calls the [Update application](/graph/api/application-update) API to add the required Microsoft Graph permissions to an app registration identified by object ID `00001111-aaaa-2222-bbbb-3333cccc4444`. This example uses `Analytics.Read` and `Application.Read.All` delegated permission and application permission. Microsoft Graph is identified as a ServicePrincipal object with `00000003-0000-0000-c000-000000000000` as its globally unique `AppId`.\n+ The following example calls the [Update application](/graph/api/application-update) API to add the required Microsoft Graph permissions to an app registration identified by object ID `ffffffff-eeee-dddd-cccc-bbbbbbbbbbb0`. This example uses `Analytics.Read` and `Application.Read.All` delegated permission and application permission. Microsoft Graph is identified as a ServicePrincipal object with `00000003-0000-0000-c000-000000000000` as its globally unique `AppId`.\n \n ```http\n PATCH https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/applications/aaaaaaaa-0000-1111-2222-bbbbbbbbbbbb\n@@ -204,7 +204,7 @@ To complete the following steps of removing permissions, you need the following\n 1. Identify the permissions for your app.\n 1. For example, to stop your app from requesting Microsoft Graph permissions, identify the Microsoft Graph permissions for your app, their permission IDs, and whether they're app roles (application permissions) or delegated permissions.\n 1. Remove the unwanted Microsoft Graph permissions from your app.\n- The following example calls the [Update application](/graph/api/application-update) API to remove the unwanted Microsoft Graph permissions from an app registration identified by a sample client ID `00001111-aaaa-2222-bbbb-3333cccc4444`. In this example, the application has `Analytics.Read`, `User.Read`, and `Application.Read.All`. We need to remove `Analytics.Read` and `Application.Read.All` delegated permission and application permission. Microsoft Graph is identified as a ServicePrincipal object with `00000003-0000-0000-c000-000000000000` as its globally unique `AppId` and Microsoft Graph as its `DisplayName` and `AppDisplayName`.\n+ The following example calls the [Update application](/graph/api/application-update) API to remove the unwanted Microsoft Graph permissions from an app registration identified by a sample client ID `ffffffff-eeee-dddd-cccc-bbbbbbbbbbb0`. In this example, the application has `Analytics.Read`, `User.Read`, and `Application.Read.All`. We need to remove `Analytics.Read` and `Application.Read.All` delegated permission and application permission. Microsoft Graph is identified as a ServicePrincipal object with `00000003-0000-0000-c000-000000000000` as its globally unique `AppId` and Microsoft Graph as its `DisplayName` and `AppDisplayName`.\n \n ```http\n PATCH https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/applications/00001111-aaaa-2222-bbbb-3333cccc4444" }, { "sha": "8774ed1cba3a1f7367fa596b162691a06f57c60e", "filename": "docs/identity-platform/reference-breaking-changes.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 2, "deletions": 2, "changes": 4, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Freference-breaking-changes.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Freference-breaking-changes.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Freference-breaking-changes.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -345,8 +345,8 @@ To remedy this issue, use the Admin Consent experience to create the client appl\n \n #### Example request\n \n-`https://login.microsoftonline.com/contoso.com/oauth2/authorize?resource=https://gateway.contoso.com/api&response_type=token&client_id=00001111-aaaa-2222-bbbb-3333cccc4444&...`\n-In this example, the resource tenant (authority) is contoso.com, the resource app is a single-tenant app called `gateway.contoso.com/api` for the Contoso tenant, and the client app is `00001111-aaaa-2222-bbbb-3333cccc4444`. If the client app has a service principal within Contoso.com, this request can continue. If it doesn't, however, then the request will fail with the error above.\n+`https://login.microsoftonline.com/contoso.com/oauth2/authorize?resource=https://gateway.contoso.com/api&response_type=token&client_id=ffffffff-eeee-dddd-cccc-bbbbbbbbbbb0&...`\n+In this example, the resource tenant (authority) is contoso.com, the resource app is a single-tenant app called `gateway.contoso.com/api` for the Contoso tenant, and the client app is `ffffffff-eeee-dddd-cccc-bbbbbbbbbbb0`. If the client app has a service principal within Contoso.com, this request can continue. If it doesn't, however, then the request will fail with the error above.\n \n If the Contoso gateway app were a multitenant application, however, then the request would continue regardless of the client app having a service principal within Contoso.com.\n " }, { "sha": "c12aa440f90b02d4f73380f5b386a35464a74449", "filename": "docs/includes/lifecycle-workflows-tasks-table.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fincludes%2Flifecycle-workflows-tasks-table.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fincludes%2Flifecycle-workflows-tasks-table.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Flifecycle-workflows-tasks-table.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -37,4 +37,5 @@ Lifecycle Workflows currently support the following tasks:\n | [Send email to manager before user's last day](../id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#send-email-to-manager-before-users-last-day) | 52853a3e-f4e5-4eb8-bb24-1ac09a1da935 | Leaver |\n | [Send email on user's last day](../id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#send-email-on-users-last-day) | 9c0a1eaf-5bda-4392-9d9e-6e155bb57411 | Leaver | \n | [Send email to user's manager after their last day](../id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#send-email-to-users-manager-after-their-last-day) | 6f22ddd4-b3a5-47a4-a846-0d7c201a49ce | Leaver |\n+| [Send email about user inactivity (Preview)](../id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#send-email-about-user-inactivity-preview) | 92f74cb4-f1b6-4ec0-b766-96210f56edc2 | Leaver |\n " } ]. ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces significant updates to the Microsoft Entra ID Governance documentation, primarily focusing on Lifecycle Workflows. Key changes include the addition of a new feature to manage inactive users, a new trigger based on sign-in activity, and enhancements to email customization within workflows. Furthermore, the documentation has been updated to reflect new workflow templates related to inactive users and adjustments to the device identity key storage process for Apple devices, alongside minor corrections in API examples and permission references.
